result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Failure to Install Ignition Interlock Device

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kayla M. Welke

defendant.name: Welke, Kayla M.
defendant.address: S9460 Hillview Rd, Fall Creek, WI 54742

records.addlTxt: Plea hearing on November 17, 2022 at 11:15 am.

Cases called at 1:36 PM: 22CF707, 22CF733, 22CF973, 22CM553, 22CT183.  Hearing held via Zoom video conferencing.
Defendant Kayla M. Welke appeared by video.  Attorney Kerry A. Kelm appeared by video for Kayla M. Welke.  Attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Kelm requests an adjournment to review the plea paperwork with the Defendant and that the ARGNs be held in 22CF707, 22CF733, 22CF973.
Defendant waives their right to appear in person and Court accepts waiver. 
22CF707, 22CF733, 22CF973: Defendant waives reading of Information and enters Not Guilty pleas. 
Plea Hearing: 11/17/22 at 11:15 AM.
Plea hearing on October 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on November 30, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Cases called at 9:43 AM: 22CF707, 22CF733, 22CF973, 22CM553, 22CT183. Defendant Kayla M. Welke in court.  Attorney Kerry A. Kelm in court for Kayla M. Welke.  Attorney Andrew Gunderson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
22CF973: Defendant waives reading of Complaint. Defendant waives her right to Preliminary Hearings in all felony matters. DAGP resolution. 
Attorney Kelm to file Substitution of Judge in 22CF707. Newly assigned court official to schedule Felony Plea Hearing.

10:03 AM cases 22CM553, 22CF733, 22CT183 and 22CF707 called. Prosecuting attorney Loralee Clark in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Kayla M. Welke in court with Attorney Kerry A. Kelm. Attorney Kelm recently appointed. 
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 08/08/2022 at 2:30 PM
Hearing scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Conditions: 
No contact with co-defendant J.P. 
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities, except in a therapeutic setting. 
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level. 
(Covers 22CM553, 22CF733)

(10:59 AM cases 22CM553, 22CF733 called.) Prosecuting attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Kayla M. Welke appeared by video, in custody in the Eau Claire County Jail. Attorney Ryan Glenn Kohler appeared by video for Kayla M. Welke.
Defendant waives formal reading of the complaints and time limits for preliminary hearing in 22CF733.
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on July 11, 2022 at 1:30 pm.
Hearing scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Conditions: 
No contact with co-defendant J.P. 
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities, except in a therapeutic setting. 
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level. 
(Covers 22CM553, 22CF733)
